events.message: The customer filed a claim reporting a car accident that caused significant damage to their vehicle and minor injuries to themselves.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the description of the collision and vehicle damage provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the claim process and gather further details about the accident.
The customer was formally notified that their claim had been received and acknowledged by the insurance company.
Request was sent to the customer asking for the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and medical reports related to the accident.
The customer submitted all requested documents including police report, photos of the damaged car, and hospital medical bill copies.
An investigation began to verify the details of the accident and assess the extent of vehicle damage and injury claims.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of the accident circumstances and validation of submitted documents and injury claims.
Settlement proposal was sent to the customer outlining the coverage amount for vehicle repair and medical expenses.
The customer responded with positive feedback accepting the proposed settlement amount and thanking the agent for support.
The claim was officially approved by the insurer after all requirements were met and the settlement was accepted.
Payment was issued to the customer covering the repair costs and reimbursements for medical treatment resulting from the accident.
The insurance claim was officially closed following successful payment and customer confirmation that the issue was resolved.
The case files and documentation were archived per policy, ensuring the claim records are securely stored for future reference.
